content: Emily Rivera, 29 years old female. Medical history: Reports occasional anxiety, no prior thyroid conditions. Last visit: June 10, 2025. Chief complaint: Persistent fatigue, dizziness, weight loss over past 3 weeks. Additional symptoms: Cold hands, shortness of breath, heart palpitations, hand tremors, and sleep disturbances. Physical exam: BP 100/65 mmHg, Pulse 108 bpm, Weight 124 lbs (down from 132 lbs last month), Temperature 98.4Â°F. Assessment: Possible hyperthyroidism or other endocrine disorder suspected. Plan: Ordered thyroid panel (TSH, T3, T4), advised daily hydration and light physical activity. Next follow-up scheduled for June 17, 2025.

Jacob Reed, 61 years old male. Medical history: Type 2 Diabetes (diagnosed 2012), Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia. Last visit: July 14, 2025. Chief complaint: Occasional chest discomfort during exertion, leg swelling, increased nighttime urination. Current medications: Metformin 1000mg twice daily, Lisinopril 20mg daily, Atorvastatin 40mg nightly. Recent labs: HbA1c 6.9%, LDL cholesterol 130 mg/dL, BNP 180 pg/mL. Physical exam: BP 135/85 mmHg, Pulse 82 bpm, Weight 205 lbs, Ankle edema present bilaterally. ECG shows mild LVH. Assessment: Possible early congestive heart failure, needs further evaluation. Plan: Echocardiogram ordered, sodium-restricted diet advised, referred to cardiology. Follow-up in 2 weeks.
